intro: Hieracium dissimile, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it typically grows in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. The plant has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy, and its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. It is a perennial herb that can spread by rhizomes, making it a potential weed in some areas. The plant's botanical features make it identifiable by its distinctive leaf shape and clustered yellow flowers.
